titleInfo.title: Chattanooga Library view from below, 1944 Febuary 23

mods.abstract: Black-and-white photograph of Chattanooga Library located in Chattanooga, Tennessee. The Chattanooga Public Library was originally a Carnegie Library, until the name was changed in 1944. The library was built with funds donated by Andrew Carnegie and located at 200 8th Street in Chattanooga, Tennessee from 1905 to 1940. The library re-located to the corner of McCallie Avenue and Douglas Streets in 1940 as part of the University of Chattanooga campus, and in 1976, the the Chattanooga Public Library returned to downtown Chattanooga on Broad Street.

titleInfo.title: Downtown Chattanooga, Tennessee in 1940s photographic prints, 1940-1949
Herman Lamb photographs
Special Collections
